item.title: Pope's visit to Lebanon sparks hope but also frustration
item.description: As Pope Leo prepares to visit northern Lebanon, Christian border villages in the south feel abandoned and struggle to rebuild after the war with Israel.

item.title: As the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season ends, the future of forecasting is AI
item.description: Meteorologists are surprised that the weather model that did the best job forecasting hurricanes this year was a new one, introduced by Google. AI may be the beginning of a new era of forecasting.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Where things stand with the National Guard shooting in D.C.
item.description: The Trump administration has halted the processing of immigration requests from Afghans and the president vowed to tighten his immigration crackdown after the shooting of two National Guard members.

item.title: They need a ventilator to stay alive. Getting one can be a nightmare
item.description: Few nursing homes can care for people who need help breathing with a ventilator because of ALS and other conditions. Insurers often deny payment for the best at-home machines, and innovative solutions are endangered by Medicaid cuts.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Trump administration pausing all asylum decisions after National Guard shooting
item.description: After the alleged shooter was identified as Rahmanullah Lakanwal — a 29-year-old Afghan national — Trump said he would permanently shut down immigration from impoverished countries.

item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced the resignation of his powerful chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, whose residence was searched earlier in the day by anti-corruption investigators.

item.title: Pope Leo prays for unity at historic Nicaea site
item.description: On the second day of his inaugural overseas trip, Pope Leo XIV visited the ancient site of the First Council of Nicaea, in Turkey, urging Christians — and all faiths — to reject the use of religion to justify violence.

item.title: Death toll from floods and landslides on Indonesia's Sumatra rises to 164
item.description: The death toll from flash floods and landslides on Indonesia's Sumatra island Friday rose to 164 on Friday with 79 people missing, authorities said.
